about_the_game:
Pixel Puzzles World War II, merging history with the definitive jigsaw puzzler on the PC platform.

The Invasion of Poland marked the harrowing onset of World War II in 1939, as Nazi Germany, led by Adolf Hitler, launched a coordinated attack on Poland from the west, while the Soviet Union invaded from the east. Employing a combination of swift armored advances and aerial bombardment, the overwhelming German forces swiftly overwhelmed Polish defenses, triggering a brutal campaign that highlighted the destructive potential of modern warfare. The invasion's rapid success showcased the effectiveness of Germany's military tactics and coordination, as well as the grim reality of civilian casualties and the devastation of cities. The tragic consequence of the Invasion of Poland was the intensification of a global conflict that would reshape the course of history.

PACK INFO:

Puzzle Count: 21
Total Piece Count: 4,872

PACK CONTENTS:

  • Warsaw after German bombardments - x140
  • Polish AA gun in Warsaw - x330
  • German troops parade through Warsaw - x216
  • German patrol - x330
  • Camouflaged German heavy artillery gun - x140
  • Parade in Brest-Litovsk - x425
  • Piece of an He-111 bomber - x330
  • Lubomirski Palace - x140
  • German dugout - x216
  • View of a Polish city - x330
  • Destroyed Polish equipment - x216
  • German bombing run - x140
  • German and Soviet soldiers talk in Brest-Litovsk - x425
  • Map - x140
  • Amongst the ruins - x216
  • Schleswig Holstein firing Westerplatte September 1939 - x216
  • German soldiers surveying the damage - x216
  • 76mm AA Gun of ORP Blyskawica - x140
  • The Royal Castle Burning - x140
  • Alexander Mach with Slovaks soldiers - x330
  • Wieluń after Luftwaffe Bombing - x96
